alert.note: Alert for South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet; West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 24 at 1:46AM MST until December 25 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Snow will be heavy at times today, and then gradually decrease in intensity by this evening. Total snow accumulations between 12 and 24 inches, with up to three feet possible in the Park Range. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass, and Rocky Mountain National Park and the Medicine Bow Range. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible.
info.instruction: Persons should consider delaying all travel until late Saturday morning. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded.
